channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Covid: Italy, Belgium and Netherlands ban flights from UK over variant
item.description: Italy is set to join the Netherlands and Belgium, with other nations also considering measures.

item.title: Covid: WHO in 'close contact' with UK over new virus variant
item.description: The variant spreads more rapidly but there is no evidence it is more deadly or vaccine resistant.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump's Covid vaccine chief admits delivery mistake
item.description: The army general apologises to states who will get fewer Pfizer doses than they were expecting.

item.title: Christmas celebrations to go ahead in Bethlehem
item.description: BBC Middle East correspondent Yolande Knell joins the rehearsals for the festive processions.

item.title: Nigeria kidnapping: Mahuta children rescued after gun battle
item.description: Police say vigilantes helped rescue 84 children after Nigeria's second mass kidnapping in eight days.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: New restrictions announced as outbreak grows
item.description: Curbs on gatherings are announced as authorities urge people to stay at home.

item.title: Joe Biden says 'no time to waste' as climate team unveiled
item.description: The US president-elect says the team will lead his "ambitious plan" to combat climate change.

item.title: Cardinal Pell says his conservative views drove public against him
item.description: The ex-Vatican treasurer was acquitted of child sexual abuse and released from prison this year.

item.title: Brexit: No trade deal unless 'substantial shift' from EU, UK says
item.description: With a decision expected before Christmas, UK sources say it is increasingly likely there will be no deal.

item.title: US cyber-attack: Russia 'clearly' behind SolarWinds operation, says Pompeo
item.description: US secretary of state says Moscow "clearly" responsible but President Trump says it's "under control".

item.title: Lionel Messi equals Pele goalscoring record with 643rd goal for Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi scores his 643rd goal for Barcelona - equalling Pele's record for goals for a single club - but his side draw at home to Valencia.

item.title: Boudicca revolt: Essex dig reveals 'evidence of Roman reprisals'
item.description: Archaeologists link the destruction of a "high status" village to the uprising in Roman Britain.

item.title: François Bozizé: CAR accuses former president of 'attempted coup'
item.description: The Central African Republic says forces loyal to François Bozizé plan to march on the capital Bangui.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'my 2020'
item.description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "my 2020".

item.title: Budget smartphones: What do you get for £100?
item.description: BBC Click's Chris Fox puts eight new budget smartphones to the test to see how they stack up.

item.title: The crucial Twitter questions of Auntie Dionne Warwick
item.description: Turns out, having a career that spans decades and being hilarious are not mutually exclusive.

item.title: Microplastics, drugs and food - how jellyfish can help us
item.description: Jellyfish are being used to develop new medicines, filters for microplastics and for food.

item.title: Blindian Project: Celebrating black and South Asian relationships
item.description: Blindian Project runs workshops to prepare couples for tricky family introductions.

item.title: North Korea: Potato propaganda is back... but what does it mean?
item.description: Why is North Korea promoting the humble spud in movies, culinary shows, and news reports?

item.title: Week in pictures: 12-18 December 2020
item.description: A selection of some of the most powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: The ghost silhouettes bringing joy to a village
item.description: Residents of West Linton have seen all kinds of creatures appear since the Covid pandemic began.

item.title: Covid vaccine: 'Disappearing' needles and other rumours debunked
item.description: We examine widely shared false claims about vaccines - from "disappearing" needles to a "dead" nurse.

item.title: Vanessa Bryant, her mother's lawsuit and the value of childcare
item.description: Vanessa Bryant's messy legal dispute with her mother has also got us talking about the value of housework.

item.title: 'God will forgive me or not': Inside the world of a people smuggler
item.description: Noor charges Afghans thousands of dollars to travel to Europe. He claims he is getting out of the business.

item.title: Uganda election: False claims about Joe Biden and others
item.description: Claims about the US president-elect are among misinformation being widely shared during an election.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: 'How we survived when Mekelle was shelled'
item.description: Ethiopia's prime minister says no civilians were killed in the Tigray conflict. Three witnesses say otherwise.

item.title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Unravelling the mystery
item.description: Antibody tests show that up to a third of South Africans may have contracted coronavirus during the first wave.

item.title: Sir David Attenborough on Joe Biden, Christmas wrapping... and flamingos
item.description: Sir David examines how wildlife adapts to the forces of nature, such as volcanoes, in a new series.

item.title: Covid: The countries worried they won't get the vaccine
item.description: Countries such as Zimbabwe, Mexico and Pakistan are likely to have to wait for the coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Faith and fertility at Bethlehem's Milk Grotto
item.description: Some say the place where Mary is said to have nursed Jesus holds the power to help couples conceive.

item.title: Superb Alvarez inflicts Smith's first career loss with emphatic display
item.description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez dominates Callum Smith with a near-flawless display to inflict the first defeat of the British fighter's career.

item.title: Christian's 50 from 15 balls helps Sixers beat Strikers in Big Bash
item.description: Dan Christian hits the second-fastest half-century in Big Bash history to propel Sydney Sixers to a 38-run victory over Adelaide Strikers.

item.title: Late Welbeck equaliser denies 10-man Sheff Utd first win
item.description: Danny Welbeck rescues a draw for Brighton as Sheffield United survive relentless pressure to claim only their second point of the season.

item.title: Shearer unsure 'awful' Arsenal will survive as Arteta admits 'other teams want it more'
item.description: Former England captain Alan Shearer says he would "not be so sure" about Arsenal surviving in the Premier League at the end of the season.

item.title: Bills win first AFC East title since 1995 as they head for NFL play-offs
item.description: The Buffalo Bills become the fifth team to book a place in the NFL play-offs after clinching their first division title since 1995.

item.title: Spain housing: Evictions and broken promises in a pandemic
item.description: Spain's prime minister promised nobody would be evicted during the pandemic but activists say thousands have.

item.title: Senegal's Dakar Fashion Week: The catwalk in a baobab forest
item.description: Held outside because of the pandemic, a fashion show in Senegal embraces the environmental message.

item.title: MasterChef final is dream come true for Nepal’s Santosh Shah
item.description: Getting to the MasterChef final is like a dream for Santosh Shah, who is from a tiny village in Nepal.

item.title: China biodegradable plastics 'failing to solve pollution crisis'
item.description: China's increase in biodegradables is outpacing its ability to degrade plastic, warns Greenpeace.

item.title: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories
item.description: Canada's "Sixties Scoop" saw thousands of indigenous children forcibly removed from their families.

item.title: Burnley's Pastor Mick - from dangerous drug dealer to lifesaver
item.description: Pastor Mick - who helps the poor on streets of Burnley - was once a violent dealer, covering up painful childhood memories.
